entries.caption: Gaussian probability density fitted to the scaled and shifted counts.
Four Gaussian curves with the same spread describe the observed salmon abundance. 5 or 6 observations in each year estimate just 2 parameters: abundance and timing.
Salmon counts scaled (from 0 to 1) by the maximum count each year.
Salmon counts as read from Parken et al. (2003) by day with all years combined.
Plot of trapezoids from salmon spawner surveys from Parken et al (2003).
Salmon counts as read from Parken et al. (2003).
Salmon counts shifted and scaled (from 0 to 1) by the maximum count, and the corresponding day, within each year.
